problems.title: Optimal Merge Pattern
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You have N sorted files with given sizes (number of records).
To merge two files of sizes A and B, the cost is A + B.
The resulting merged file has size A + B.

You need to merge all files into a single file.
Find the minimum total cost of merging.

This is the classic Optimal Merge Pattern problem.

Greedy Strategy: Always merge the two smallest files first!
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
20 30 10 5 30

Sample Output
205

Explanation:
Files: [20, 30, 10, 5, 30]

Step 1: Merge 5 and 10 → Cost = 15, Files: [20, 30, 15, 30]
Step 2: Merge 15 and 20 → Cost = 35, Files: [30, 35, 30]
Step 3: Merge 30 and 30 → Cost = 60, Files: [35, 60]
Step 4: Merge 35 and 60 → Cost = 95, Files: [95]

Total Cost = 15 + 35 + 60 + 95 = 205

Pop two smallest, merge (cost = sum), push merged file back. Repeat until one file. Sum of all merge costs is the answer.
